measured_by: Chinese version Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)
justification: “The Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES)… was used to measure the risk of depression.”
“The subjective well-being questionnaire (SWB) consisted of the positive affect and negative affect scale (PANAS) and the life satisfaction scale.”
“PANAS… included 20-item in two dimensions: positive affect (PA: 10 items…).”
The same PANAS paragraph notes the second dimension is “negative affect (NA: 10 items…).”
“The Chinese version life satisfaction scale was developed by Xiong and Xu… including five items.”
“The simplified WCQ included 20 items of two dimensions: positive coping (PC: composed items 1-12…).”
The same WCQ description states the second dimension as “negative coping (NC: composed items 13-20…).”
“The ERQ… consists of 10 items. It included two subscales: a cognitive reappraisal (6 items…).”
The ERQ paragraph lists the second subscale as “expression suppression (4 items…).”
